p: We hypothesized that the intrathecal administration of allogeneic ASCs into healthy horses would be safe, as measured by clinical neurological evaluation, blood work, and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) analysis, that the ASCs would distribute throughout the subarachnoid space after both LS and AO injection, and that ASCs administered in horses with severe neurological disease would migrate to the neurological injury site and would survive for 2Â weeks.
